snippet: After meeting with the Rev. Al Sharpton and other civil rights advocates, New York City retailers released a policy document in a response to accusations of racial profiling of black shoppers.
abstract: Macy’s, Barneys New York and other major New York City retailers are posting Customers’ Bill of Rights that addresses racial profiling; one-page document is released after meetings with Rev Al Sharpton and other civil rights advocates and is latest and most public effort by stores in New York City to respond to accusations of profiling of black shoppers.
lead_paragraph: After meeting with the Rev. Al Sharpton and other civil rights advocates, New York City retailers released a policy document in a response to accusations of racial profiling of black shoppers.

headline.main: Macy’s and Barneys Among Stores to Post Shoppers’ ‘Bill of Rights’
headline.print_headline: Some Stores to Post Shoppers’ ‘Bill of Rights,’ Addressing Racial Profiling
